lever.additional:
The Corporate Affairs (CA) team is the custodian of Gojek’s most important intangible asset: its reputation. It is managed through a combination of corporate, external, and internal communications; public affairs; stakeholder engagement; sustainability; and strategic planning programs and initiatives. 

Within CA, Internal Comms aims to ensure effective communication across the Gojek organization by working with senior management and key internal decision makers and teams, in support of employees at all levels. This is done by improving internal alignment through enhanced comms channels, platforms, and practices that create and maintain a culture of transparency and purpose for all employees. 

Gojek is an equal opportunity workplace that is committed to diversity and inclusion. At Gojek we celebrate our differences, because we believe that diversity not only creates a healthier work environment for our employees, but also helps our business thrive. 



About us

Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!
lever.description:
Supporting Internal Communications VP and SM in actualizing Gojek’s objective of becoming a powerful global brand and world-class workplace through excellent internal communications practices and programs and interdepartmental collaboration that inform and engage employees at all levels.

What success looks like:
- Increased employee satisfaction toward Gojek internal communications practices and transparent culture.
- Improved information intake and engagement.
- Measurement tools: eNPS score, HR employee survey and focus group discussion results.

lists.content:
• Supporting:
  • Coordination with all corporate and PDG functions on development of internal communications content for distribution on internal communications channels (e.g., business round-ups, organizational programs/announcements, townhalls, etc.).
  • Internal channel development, management, monitoring, evaluation, and content development.

  • Assisting:
  • Special projects, involving ad hoc projects that are urgent in nature (e.g., rebranding, crisis, etc.)

  • Stakeholders: 
  • Co-CEOs Office.
  • Senior management (head of product, head of function; PDG and corporate).
  • HR/PAC teams on employee engagement and communication initiatives.
  • IT Infra and InfoSec teams for channel assessment and technical support.
  • Other Corporate Affairs teams: Corporate Communications, Corporate Strategy, International Comms on content coordination for non ID markets (SG, VN, TH, IN, etc), etc.

• Excellent English and native Bahasa (written and spoken) as determined through Gojek written assessment.
  • At least 5 years of experience in comms or related area.
  • Strong communication, presentation, project management, and people engagement skills; managing up capability; multitasking proficiency; vendor management; and alignment to fast-paced speed of business.

• Overseas graduate and/or international scholarship recipient (AMINEF, Chevening, etc.).
  • Well-versed in G Suite interface (E-mail, Doc, Slide, etc).
  • Experience with channel management of Slack, Slido, Zoom, Workday, and/or other similar tools.
  • Basic to intermediate graphic design and photography skills and/or deep familiarity with the processes.
